des:
LinknLink Skill is your key to unlocking a truly smart and interconnected home. This skill allows perfect voice control of your LinknLink smart home devices, making home management easier and more efficient.

Prerequisites:
1. An iPhone/iPad or Android phone
2. A Wi-Fi router with 2.4G band and Internet access
3. A LinknLink smart home device

To get started:

1. Sign up / sign in LinknLink App
Download and install LinknLink App from App Store or Google Play and sign up for a LinknLink account.
LinknLink is a free smart home app that helps you manage LinknLink smart devices on your phone, including but not limited to the media player, smart gateway, IR blaster, RF remote, temperature and humidity sensor, radar sensor, and energy monitoring devices.

2. Add device
Make sure the Wi-Fi device has been correctly configured in LinknLink App (following the wizard in the app or quick manual from the product package) and you can remotely control/access it via external networks (4G/5G).

3. Enable skill
In Alexa App, search and enable the skill “LinknLink”. Then follow the wizard to link your Amazon account to your LinknLink account.
After the account linking process is completed, discover devices in Alexa App or say “Alexa, discover devices” and make sure devices are listed and displayed with the same names in LinknLink App.

4. Control device by voice

Now you can say to Alexa for voice control.
For instance, if you added an IR blaster in LinknLink and paired it with a "TV", you will get a "TV" show up in Alexa App if the account linking is done. Then you can use voice to control it like:
"Alexa, turn on the TV";
"Alexa, volume up on the TV";
"Alexa, change the channel to 11 on the TV";
"Alexa, set the TV to HDMI"

Troubleshooting:
If Alexa returns a voice showing the device isn’t responding, there might be because the device is offline. Please try to access the device in LinknLink App. If the App shows “Device is offline”, please check your network connection until you can access the device in the LinknLink app.
